payload.name: explanation-based-learning
payload.core: Use an explanation of why a solution works to generalize a reusable rule or plan; the explanation constrains and justifies the generalization.
out: reusable rules derived from specific examples
proc: construct explanation of why the solution works
identify generalizable components in the explanation
derive reusable rule constrained by the explanation
check: empirically validated, not just internally elegant?

diff.vs_inductive: guided and validated by deductive explanation rather than pure pattern observation
diff.vs_analogical: requires explicit explanatory justification for transfer
diff.vs_case_based: demands explanatory reasoning, not just case retrieval

fail.desc: explanations that are internally elegant but empirically incorrect; a beautiful theory of why something worked can still be wrong

use: creating reusable patterns from specific successes

ex.scenario: an expert debugs a complex production outage caused by cascading timeouts
ex.approach: explain why the fix worked (timeout propagation chain); generalize to a reusable circuit-breaker pattern applicable to similar distributed systems
